data.title: What is the Value of a Regent University Degree?
data.meta_description: Is Regent worth the price? Read our analysis of the value of a Regent degree including value rankings and comparisons.
data.text:
Above Average Value Nationwide

Top 30% National Value

Top 50% National Quality

Good Price

Regent University is ranked #584 out of 2,223 for value nationwide.

Regent University is priced competitvely when compared to other colleges of similar quality. Based on this information we believe it is a good price for the type of education provided.

National Value Ranking Â 584 out of 2223

National Value Score Â 73.94 out of 100

Prices of Institutions with Similar Quality Scores

*Total price is determined by multiplying average annual cost by time to graduate.

We're Looking at a Total Cost of $105,744 for a Regent Degree

The average Regent student's degree will cost an estimated $105,744. This is based on an average price (with and without aid) of $23,924 and a typical 4.42 years to graduate.

Many Factors Affect Net Price

Consider the average Regent student takes 4.42 years to complete their degree. If you can complete your degree faster than that you will save money. This is just one way your Regent degree may cost less than average.

Does This School Make Financial Sense To You?

$99,194 In-State With Aid

$133,674 Avg Cost No Aid

4.42 Years to Graduate

The overall price of a college can vary depending on your individual circumstances.

Look at the table below to get a sense of how Regent value for your educational dollar might vary.

Note: the Value Grade for in-state students is calculated by looking only at other schools in the state of Virginia.

About 100% of Regent students receive financial aid. Get more details on what Regent financial aid you may qualify for.

How to Finance The Gap

How to Calculate Value

College Factual calculates average total cost by multiplying net price by time to graduation. We then compare the average total cost to other schools of a similar quality to determine value. If the school is priced fairly based on the educational quality it receives a fair ranking. If it is underpriced it receives a good or excellent value.

Read the full Best for the Money Ranking Methodology.
